intro: Corynotheca lateriflora var. laevisperma, commonly known as the smooth-fruited corynotheca, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, hairy stems and compound leaves with serrated margins. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. The variety laevisperma is distinguished by its smooth, hairless fruits, which set it apart from other variants of the species.
